Third party cookies might collect aggregated information like the frequency of your visit or the length. No Personal or Professional information is collected. The information collected might be used for analytics. A cookie may also be placed by our advertising partners. Such cookies are used only for purposes of tracking the effectiveness of advertising on our Website and no personal or professional information is gathered from you by the use of these cookies, nor is this information shared with any third parties. Third - party advertising companies or advertisement providers may also employ cookies. Such information will be anonymous and will be to measure the effectiveness of ads. Most Web browsers automatically accept cookies. In case you do not want to accept our cookie policy, you can change the settings of your browser, blocking cookies may affect your user experience
To estimate our audience size and usage pattern
To store information about Your preferences, and so allow us to customise our Site according to Your individual interests
To recogniseYou when You return to our Site

Details of Your visits to our Site including, but not limited to, traffic data, location data, weblogs and other communication data, whether this is required for our own billing purposes or otherwise and the resources that You access
Any other information You provide to us in connection with Your use of the website
Payments are routed through Times of Money
We do not save your personal or professional information using cookies. We only use cookies to personalize your experience

We may collect information about Your computer, including, where available, Your IP address, operating system and browser type, for system administration and to report aggregate information to our business partners. This is statistical data about our users\' browsing actions and patterns, and does not identify any specific individual or personal information. For the same reason, we may obtain information about Your general internet usage by using a cookie file which is stored on the hard drive of Your computer. Cookies contain information that is transferred to Your computer\'s hard drive. They help us to improve our Site and to deliver a better and more personalised service. They enable us:

Cookies are files or pieces of information that may be stored on your computer (or other internet enabled devices, such as a smart phone or tablet) when you visit our site. Cookies are stored in your browser\'s file directory. Next time you visit the site, your browser will read the cookie and relay the information back to the website or element that originally set the cookie. A cookie will usually contain the name of the website from which the cookie has come from, the "lifetime" of the cookie (i.e. how long it will remain on your device), and a value, which is usually a randomly generated unique number.

In the event of Namakoti deciding the dispute in User\'s favour, Namakoti shall refund the decided amount without any interest to the User and payments shall be made by cheque.

string.name: instructions_on_how
string.u: Instructions on how to write Nama Koti

resources.string: While we don\'t ourselves prescribe any particular rules for using this application, we believe that that in the interest of the Bhakta that it is would be beneficial to adhere to the following when Chanting God’s name using NamaKoti.

In the Hindu Dharma, it is said that writing a God's name 10 million times or One Crore times can enable the soul to reach salvation. While many of us would like to do this, we are often caught with time pressures – to write, keep track of the writing and finally have the books in which they are written printed & sent to the appropriate temples. Now with NAMAKOTI APPLICATION, you can have all this done using your smartphone.


So, whether you are Rama / Shiva / Sai Devotee, you can now use your smartphone for constant ‘diava chintana’ – or constant remembrance and utterance of God's name – enabling you to cleanse your thoughts and focus on the Supreme Being. We have built user interfaces to suit your style of chanting God's name; so depending on your specific need for a given time, you could choose Swipe and Chant – Use simple finger based swipe utility to keep chanting God's name 
Key-in Mode – Use preselected God's name and chant using a simple keyword select option 
Japamala Mode – We know that some of us would like to use the Japamala or the Rosary for chanting God's name. To meet this specific requirement of yours, we have provided you with the e-Japamala interface.

As you write (chant) the name of your favourite God or Kula Daivam, you can use the unique facility provided by Namakoti to have your Namas printed and mailed to temples – either of your choice or those that are usually know for accepting such books (eg. Bhadrachalam, in Telangana, for Rama Koti). We have also provided with a facility where in you can upload scanned images of your manuscript, that is write the God\'s name in your own handwriting, scan this using the camera on your smartphone, have that image uploaded. We will then have the books printed with this, thereby giving you the satisfaction of seeing your own handwriting in the printed books.
JAI SRI RAM * OM NAMAH SHIVAYA * OM SRI SAI

In the Hindu Dharma, it is said that writing a God\'s name 10 million times or One Crore times can enable the soul to reach salvation. While many of us would like to do this, we are often caught with time pressures – to write, keep track of the writing and finally have the books in which they are written printed & sent to the appropriate temples.
\n\nNow With NAMAKOTI Application, You Can Have All This Done using your Smartphone.

So, whether you are Rama Bhakta, Shiva Bhakta or a Sai Devotee, you can now use your Smartphone for constant ‘dayva chintana’ – or constant remembrance and utterance of God’s name – enabling you to cleanse your thoughts and focus on the Supreme Being. 

We have built user interfaces to suit your style of chanting God’s name; so depending on your specific need for a given time, you could choose.
\n\nNow With NAMAKOTI Application, You Can Have All This Done using your Smartphone.
Use simple finger based swipe utility to keep chanting God’s name.\n
Terms of use of Site and Restrictions

You agree not to use any device, software or routine to interfere with the proper working of the Site or which is intended to damage, interfere with, surreptitiously intercept or expropriate any system, data or personal information. You agree not to take any action (including without limitation, spamming) that imposes an unreasonable load on our infrastructure. You agree not to take any actions which may undermine the integrity of our system or the Services, uploading of files or content that contains material that violates the intellectual property rights of others. You are solely responsible and will comply, at Your own expense, with all applicable laws and regulations regarding Your use of the Services and the transfer of the technologies or information with which You are involved, including without limitation, import/export requirements, and Namakoti expressly disclaims any liability or responsibility thereto. You shall not use the Services in any manner, or in furtherance of any activity that may cause Namakoti to be subject to investigation, prosecution, or legal action.
Use preselected God’s name and chant using a simple keyword select option.\n
We know that some of us would like to use the Japamala or the Rosary for chanting God’s name. To meet this specific requirement of yours, we have provided you with the e-Japamala interface.\n
If there are any questions regarding this Terms & Conditions of use of this Website and its services, You may contact us at the coordinates below:

Plot No. 2, 1st Floor Simhapuri Colony,
West Marredpally,Secunderabad-500 026.
Mobile: +91 8008571122
Telephone: +91 40 40265661

As you write (chant) the name of your favorite God or Kula Dayvam, you can use the unique facility provided by Namakoti to have your Namas printed and mailed to temples – either of your choice or those that are usually know for accepting such books (eg. Bhadrachalam, in Telangana, for Rama Koti).\n
Instructions on how to write Nama Koti\n

While we don’t ourselves prescribe any particular rules for using this application, we believe that in the interest of the Bhakta that it is would be beneficial to adhere to the following when Chanting God’s name using NamaKoti.

Preferably start the Chanting process, after taking your bath.


Donot write or Chant the name, when doing activities such as eating, attending natures call and other similar activities.


Please focus on the God when writing/chanting his name. Technology is being used as a tool to help you which hitherto made the whole process cumbersome, bit that doesnot however mean you give up the basic tenants of the processes.


Remember that Chanting a God’s name is the most important way of reaching to the Supreme Being and that it should be done with Devotion and Dedication showing the highest of respect and sincerity in the process.

While we don\'t ourselves prescribe any particular rules for using this application, we believe that that in the interest of the Bhakta that it is would be beneficial to adhere to the following when Chanting God\'s name using NamaKoti.
In whose name to be printed
Beyond 10000 chants, you need to upgrade your account by paying ONE TIME UPGRADE FEE of INR 121/ USD 2.5, for which you can chant namas of all the gods and upload of handwritten chant for printing.
You need to pay INR 121/USD 2.5 for upgrading your account. The upgrade enables you to
Beyond 10000 chants, you will need to upgrade your account by paying INR 116 or USD 2
There will be extra charges, if you wish to print the nama chants and delivered to a temple of your choice
Start Chanting by selecting the namam
Select the Language and Nama of your choice
Set the Nama first before going to chant
You have to upgrade for further chanting
You have to upgrade for chanting another god
No of Nama\'s to be Printed

string.name: sign_in_different_user
string.u: Already user\nlogin as a different user

resources.string: Select the God you want to chant
Enter the name of the person
Move the japamala bead upwards or downwards to write the nama.
Drag the feather into the book to write the nama.
Touch the orange keys in the sequence order to write the nama.
Write/ Japa mala / Key Touch Chant Option.
You need to register before you proceed.
Click on, the create Nama button for setting the Nama for the selected god.
Create your detailed profile for processing further requirements on the portal.\nClick on the update icon.\nEnter your personal details.
Enter a valid email address/mobile number/user name. This will be your user id.
Enter the password and confirm the same. Your password should have alteast 5 characters.
Enter your First and Last name.
Enter the Mobile number for future communications.
Select the country for populating the ISD Code for your mobile number.
Click on the "Submit" button for confirming the details for user creation.
Step 1: Select the nama count to be printed.
Step 2: Select the temple of your choice for delivering the book.
Step 3: Enter the name of the person to be printed on the book; default name shall be the name of the registered person.
Step 4: Choose print type. The default setting is that of a book.
Step 5: You have an option of having the namas printed as if they were actually written by you. For doing a manuscript like printing, please follow the steps below
Click or select on Yes to manuscript printing

Ensure that you have a image of your ‘manuscript’ is uploaded on your device. In case you don’t have one, use the camera on your phone to capture the image. Once you have captured it, move the image to the Image Gallery (by default a photo taken will be in the gallery).
Open the image that you want to upload
You will need to crop the image before it can be used for printing. Cropping is nothing but ensuring that the image fits a pre-determined size

To crop select the Cropping Tool – this will throw up a checked box around the image. Drag the borders on the image. Once you are sure that the image that you want is covered by the box, you are ready to upload that for printing
Click on the Back Button on your device
The image that will be used for printing will now appear just above the Pay button.
Step 6: Once you are done with the above steps, click on the Pay button which will redirect you to the payment gateway. You can choose the most suitable payment option.
Disclaimer : The total charges for various activities (Printing / Shipping / Temple expenses) are based on tariff rates mentioned by various vendors and these are all indicative prices.
Use the unique feature of Namakoti to have your Namas printed and delivered to the temples of your choice. Follow the following sequence of steps to do this

Namakoti’s uses a Freemium model – that is combination of Free and Premium payment model. So, as a free user you can chant Nama for any God upto 10000 times. However if you want to Chant for more than 10,000 times, and/or Print what you have chanted and sent to the Temple of your choice, You will have to upgrade your account to a Premium one, by paying INR 121 (for Indian customers) or USD 2.5 (for international customers).

If you decide to upgrade your application, then Click on the upgrade button option shown in your Chant screen. Which in turn will give you two options \n I.\t Upgrade and Print \n II.\t Upgrade and continue, which implies you would like to exercise you print option at a later point of time

Click on the Transaction Tab, to view the all the print requests and payment details of your past transactions.\nClick on the Delivery Tab, to view the all the statuses of the deliveries of nama books
Select the chant, which you have registered for chanting.

Once you start chanting, a counter helps keep track of the number of times you chant the God’s name. There are three different counters you will see on the screen. Total Count gives you the number of times you have chanted God’s name, since you registered started using Namakoti. Print Count, gives the number of Nama’s you have ordered to be printed and delivered. Running Count gives the number of chants, since you last print order. For example, if you have chanted 15650 times since registration and then ordered a print of say 10,000 to be printed and sent to a temple. Then your total count will be 15,650, Print Count will be 10,000 and running count will be 5,650 (15,650 – 100000).
As a user you have three options or ways in which you can do your nama japana.
Write Option: In this method you just need to drag the feather into the book to write the nama.
Key Touch: Touch the keys in the sequence order to write the nama – touch the key which is orange color.
Japamala Option: Move the japamala bead upwards or downwards to write the nama.
You have downloaded an App, so in order to synchronize the count with our central database click on the icon to sync the data (by default application will sync the data for every 100 chants done).
Select the language in which you wish to chant.
You can select your chosen way for chanting the name of your favourite deity.

Enter the name of the devotee who is writing the namakoti. The default setting is the name of the person who registers. You can choose to have it dedicated to other people, such as your parents or siblings or others.
Ensure that you save the settings by Clicking on Save button.
You can print and deliver the Nama to the Temple of your Choice
